name: P-gp induction can decrease exposure of P-gp substrates

scenario.notes: Reference P-gp induction interaction involving a narrow therapeutic index substrate.

actions: Use caution when combining strong P-gp inducers with narrow-TI substrates.
Monitor for reduced effect (and levels when applicable) and adjust therapy as clinically appropriate.
Recognize induction onset and offset are delayed (not immediate).

rationale: Reduced exposure may be clinically important for narrow-TI drugs.

explanation_template: {B_name} is a strong P-gp inducer and {A_name} is a P-gp substrate with a narrow therapeutic index. This can decrease systemic exposure and reduce effect.

references.citation: Transporter induction + narrow therapeutic index can be clinically meaningful even if magnitude varies.
